p: Alternatively, Culex spp. mosquitoes exhibit enhanced survivorship with increasing sucrose meal concentrations, but their ability to transmit West Nile virus actually decreases ( Vaidyanathan et al. 2008). A different study observed a significant difference in sugar and host feeding between diapausing and non-diapausing female Cx. pipiens ( Bowen 1992). Significant differences in longevity and fecundity of Cx. pipiens pallens were observed in mosquitoes reared on different flowering plants and seed pods ( Yu et al. 2016). Accordingly, heterogeneity in sugar resources could have a profound effect on when and where populations of mosquitoes can support arbovirus transmission among Culex species as well.
